alert.note: Alert for Brazoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 2:15PM CST until January 27 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Colorado, Wharton, Austin and Fort Bend Counties. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Brazoria and Fort Bend Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River near Sweeny. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water begins spilling into the left floodplain. Water is over the mid level walkway at the Phillips Terminal near Sweeny. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM CST Friday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 2.7 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 12/09/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon San Bernard River Sweeny 7.0 9.9 Fri 1 pm CST 6.4 5.6 6.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.Saturday morning at 815 AM CST.
